alert.note: Alert for Brooks; Inland Kenedy; Inland Willacy; Northern Hidalgo (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 01 at 9:39PM CST until January 02 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 6 PM CST SUNDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, north winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts 40 to 45 mph expected. For the Freeze Watch, sub- freezing temperatures as low as 29 possible. * WHERE...Brooks, Inland Kenedy, Inland Willacy and Northern Hidalgo Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, from 6 AM to 6 PM CST Sunday. For the Freeze Watch, from late Sunday night through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Freezing temperatures 32 degrees or below may occur for 2 to 5 hours.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
